Title: Verify Patient Registration
Description: Verify that a patient can successfully register on the application.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in the sign-up form with valid details. 3. Submit the form.
Action: Submit the sign-up form.
Data: Valid patient details (e.g., name, email, password).
Result: The patient is successfully registered, and a confirmation message is displayed.

Title: Verify Invalid Patient Registration
Description: Verify that the system handles invalid inputs during patient registration.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in the sign-up form with invalid details (e.g., missing required fields). 3. Submit the form.
Action: Submit the sign-up form with invalid data.
Data: Invalid patient details (e.g., missing email, weak password).
Result: The system displays error messages for the invalid fields and does not register the patient.

Title: Verify Doctor Search Functionality
Description: Verify that a patient can search for a doctor's information.
Precondition: The patient is logged into the application.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the doctor search page. 2. Enter valid search criteria (e.g., doctor's name, specialty). 3. Submit the search query.
Action: Submit the search query.
Result: The system displays a list of doctors matching the search criteria.

Title: Verify Appointment Booking
Description: Verify that a patient can book an appointment with a diagnostic center.
Precondition: The patient is logged into the application.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the appointment booking page. 2. Select a diagnostic center and a specific time slot. 3. Submit the appointment request.
Action: Submit the appointment request.
Data: Valid diagnostic center and time slot details.
Result: The system confirms the appointment and calculates the waiting time.

Title: Verify Appointment Booking with Invalid Time Slot
Description: Verify that the system handles invalid time slots during appointment booking.
Precondition: The patient is logged into the application.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the appointment booking page. 2. Select a diagnostic center and an invalid time slot (e.g., already booked, past time). 3. Submit the appointment request.
Action: Submit the appointment request with an invalid time slot.
Result: The system displays an error message indicating the invalid time slot and does not book the appointment.

Title: Verify System Response Time Under Load
Description: Test the system's response time when multiple users are accessing the application simultaneously.
Precondition: The application is deployed and running in a staging environment.
Steps: 1. Simulate 1000 concurrent users accessing the application. 2. Measure the average response time for key functionalities such as login, viewing doctor information, and booking appointments. 3. Compare the response time against the defined performance standards.
Action: Simulate load and measure response time.
Result: The average response time should be within the acceptable limits defined in the performance standards.

Title: Test Access Control for Different User Roles
Description: Verify that different user roles (Patient, Doctor, Diagnostic Center) have appropriate access levels.
Precondition: User accounts for each role are created.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient and attempt to access Doctor and Diagnostic Center functionalities. 2. Log in as a Doctor and attempt to access Patient and Diagnostic Center functionalities. 3. Log in as a Diagnostic Center and attempt to access Patient and Doctor functionalities. 4. Verify that each role can only access their designated functionalities.
Action: Attempt to access functionalities as different user roles.
Result: Each user role should only be able to access their designated functionalities.

Title: Verify Data Integrity During Concurrent Updates
Description: Ensure that data remains accurate and authentic when multiple users update the same record simultaneously.
Precondition: The application is deployed and running in a staging environment.
Steps: 1. Simulate two users attempting to update the same patient record simultaneously. 2. Verify that the final state of the record reflects the most recent update. 3. Check for any data inconsistencies or corruption.
Action: Simulate concurrent updates and verify data integrity.
Result: The final state of the record should reflect the most recent update without any data inconsistencies.

Title: Test System Behavior Under Failure Conditions
Description: Assess the system's reliability by simulating failure conditions and verifying recovery time.
Precondition: The application is deployed and running in a staging environment.
Steps: 1. Simulate a system failure by shutting down the database server. 2. Measure the time taken for the system to recover and become fully operational again. 3. Verify that all data remains intact and no data loss occurs.
Action: Simulate system failure and measure recovery time.
Result: The system should recover within the defined mean time to recovery (MTTR) and no data loss should occur.

Title: Verify System Scalability with Increasing User Load
Description: Check the system's performance as the number of concurrent users increases.
Precondition: The application is deployed and running in a staging environment.
Steps: 1. Start with 100 concurrent users and gradually increase the load to 1000 users. 2. Monitor the system's performance metrics such as response time, throughput, and resource utilization. 3. Ensure that the system can handle the increased load without significant degradation in performance.
Action: Gradually increase user load and monitor performance.
Result: The system should handle the increased load without significant degradation in performance.

Title: Verify Successful Login with Valid Credentials
Description: Ensure that a user can successfully log in with valid credentials.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a valid username and password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Enter valid credentials and attempt to log in.
Result: The user should be successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Title: Attempt Login with Invalid Credentials
Description: Ensure that the system prevents login with invalid credentials.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter an invalid username and/or password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Enter invalid credentials and attempt to log in.
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent login.

Title: Test for SQL Injection Vulnerability
Description: Ensure that the system is protected against SQL injection attacks.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with SQL injection code (e.g., ' OR '1'='1). 3. Enter any password. 4. Click the login button.
Action: Enter SQL injection code in the username field and attempt to log in.
Data: SQL injection code in the username field
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent login.

Title: Test for Session Hijacking
Description: Ensure that the system is protected against session hijacking.
Precondition: A valid user session is active.
Steps: 1. Log in with valid credentials. 2. Capture the session ID from the browser cookies. 3. Use a different browser or incognito window to attempt login with the captured session ID.
Action: Capture and reuse the session ID in a different browser.
Result: The system should not allow login with the captured session ID and should invalidate the session.

Title: Test for Unauthorized Access to Patient Reports
Description: Ensure that unauthorized users cannot access patient reports.
Precondition: A user is logged in with non-admin privileges.
Steps: 1. Log in with a non-admin user account. 2. Attempt to access patient reports.
Action: Attempt to access patient reports with non-admin privileges.
Result: The system should display an access denied message and prevent access to patient reports.

Title: Load Test - Patient Registration
Description: Simulate multiple patients registering simultaneously to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Simulate 100 concurrent users accessing the registration page. 2. Each user fills out the registration form with unique data. 3. Each user submits the registration form. 4. Measure the response time for each registration.
Action: Simulate 100 concurrent users registering.
Data: Unique registration data for each user.
Result: All users should successfully register with an average response time of less than 5 seconds.

Title: Stress Test - Appointment Booking
Description: Push the system beyond its limits by simulating a large number of users booking appointments simultaneously.
Precondition: 1000 users should be logged into the system.
Steps: 1. Simulate 1000 concurrent users searching for available appointment slots. 2. Each user selects an available slot and books an appointment. 3. Measure the system's response time and stability.
Action: Simulate 1000 concurrent users booking appointments.
Result: The system should handle the load without crashing, with an acceptable degradation in response time.

Title: Endurance Test - Doctor Login
Description: Evaluate the system's ability to sustain a prolonged load of doctors logging in over an extended period.
Precondition: The system should be stable and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 50 doctors logging in every minute for 24 hours. 2. Measure the system's response time and resource utilization. 3. Ensure that all doctors can log in successfully.
Action: Simulate 50 doctors logging in every minute for 24 hours.
Result: All doctors should be able to log in successfully throughout the test period with consistent response times.

Title: Scalability Test - Increasing Patient Load
Description: Determine the system's ability to handle an increasing number of patients accessing their reports.
Precondition: The system should be stable and running.
Steps: 1. Start with 100 concurrent users accessing their reports. 2. Gradually increase the number of concurrent users by 100 every 5 minutes up to 1000 users. 3. Measure the system's response time and resource utilization at each increment.
Action: Gradually increase the number of concurrent users accessing their reports.
Result: The system should handle the increasing load with acceptable response times and resource utilization.

Title: Load Test - Diagnostic Center Upload Reports
Description: Simulate multiple diagnostic centers uploading reports simultaneously to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Simulate 50 concurrent diagnostic centers accessing the report upload page. 2. Each center uploads 10 reports. 3. Measure the response time for each upload.
Action: Simulate 50 concurrent diagnostic centers uploading reports.
Result: All reports should be successfully uploaded with an average response time of less than 10 seconds.

Title: Test Username Login with Minimum Length
Description: Verify that the system allows login with the minimum acceptable username length.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with the minimum length (assuming minimum length is 3 characters, e.g., "abc"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Action: Login with minimum length username
Result: The system should allow the user to log in successfully.

Title: Test Username Login with Maximum Length
Description: Verify that the system allows login with the maximum acceptable username length.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with the maximum length (assuming maximum length is 20 characters, e.g., "abcdefghijklmnopqrst"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Action: Login with maximum length username
Result: The system should allow the user to log in successfully.

Title: Test Username Login with Value Just Below Minimum
Description: Verify that the system does not allow login with a username length just below the minimum.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with a length just below the minimum (assuming minimum length is 3 characters, e.g., "ab"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Action: Login with username length just below minimum
Result: The system should display an error message indicating the username is too short.

Title: Test Username Login with Value Just Above Maximum
Description: Verify that the system does not allow login with a username length just above the maximum.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with a length just above the maximum (assuming maximum length is 20 characters, e.g., "abcdefghijklmnopqrstu"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Action: Login with username length just above maximum
Result: The system should display an error message indicating the username is too long.

Title: Test Username Login with Invalid Input
Description: Verify that the system does not allow login with an invalid username format.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter an invalid username format (e.g., "user@name"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Action: Login with invalid username format
Result: The system should display an error message indicating the username format is invalid.

Title: Verify Password Requirements
Description: Ensure that the system enforces password requirements such as length, special characters, expiry, and recycling policies.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Attempt to create a new account with a password that does not meet the required criteria (e.g., less than 8 characters, no special characters). 3. Attempt to create a new account with a password that meets the required criteria.
Action: Create a new account with varying password criteria.
Result: The system should prevent account creation with non-compliant passwords and allow creation with compliant passwords.

Title: Verify Data Classification and Protection
Description: Ensure that all data is protectively marked, stored, and protected according to relevant regulations.
Precondition: The system is operational, and user accounts are created.
Steps: 1. Log in as a patient. 2. View and interact with personal health information. 3. Log out and log in as a different user role (e.g., doctor or diagnostic center). 4. Attempt to access the personal health information of the patient from the previous step.
Action: Access personal health information from different user roles.
Data: Personal health information of a patient.
Result: The system should prevent unauthorized access to personal health information based on user roles and permissions.

Title: Verify Inactivity Timeouts
Description: Ensure that the system enforces inactivity timeouts to enhance security.
Precondition: A user is logged into the system.
Steps: 1. Log in as a patient. 2. Remain inactive for the specified timeout period. 3. Attempt to perform an action that requires authentication.
Action: Remain inactive and attempt to perform an action.
Result: The system should log out the user after the inactivity timeout period and require re-authentication.

Title: Verify Data Integrity for Test Reports
Description: Ensure that test reports are processed accurately and any incorrect reports are flagged to prevent false medication.
Precondition: Test reports are available in the system.
Steps: 1. Log in as a diagnostic center. 2. Upload a test report with incorrect data. 3. Log in as a doctor and view the test report. 4. Log in as a patient and view the test report.
Action: Upload and view test reports with incorrect data.
Result: The system should flag the incorrect test report and prevent it from being used for medication decisions.

Title: Verify Access Permissions for Different User Roles
Description: Ensure that the system enforces access permissions based on user roles (patient, doctor, diagnostic center).
Precondition: User accounts for different roles are created.
Steps: 1. Log in as a patient and attempt to access doctor-specific functionalities. 2. Log in as a doctor and attempt to access diagnostic center-specific functionalities. 3. Log in as a diagnostic center and attempt to access patient-specific functionalities.
Action: Attempt to access functionalities specific to other user roles.
Result: The system should prevent access to functionalities specific to other user roles based on the logged-in user's role.
